meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's that time again, folks! I'm donning my best reviewin' hat to give you the lowdown on LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2. Because, let's be real, who doesn't love a good dose of superhero fun in their gaming diet?

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Isn't this just more of the same old LEGO gameplay?" And to that, I say... guilty as charged! But, dear reader, it's not all bad. In fact, this game is like a warm hug from your favorite Marvel buddy (you know, the one who doesn't get enough screen time). It's got charm, it's got humor, and it's got... well, let's just say it's got a whole lot of awesome.

Of course, not everyone agrees. Take IGN, for instance. They gave this game an 80 out of 100, saying it's "constantly fun to play" - especially in co-op mode. Meanwhile, GameSpot was a tad more lukewarm, giving it a 70 and remarking that while it's still fun, the game is starting to get a bit long in the tooth (or should I say, cape?).

But hey, being the hip critic that I am, I'm all about embracing the formula. And let me tell you, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 delivers on its promise of zany humor and clever nods to the Marvel universe. Sure, it's not exactly pushing the boundaries of innovation (see: Destructoid's review), but when you've got a formula that works, why fix what ain't broke?

Gaming Age put it best: "Warner Brothers will keep churning them out" - and I'm all for it! As long as they keep pumping out these charming little bundles of LEGO-y joy, I'll be here to enthusiastically endorse 'em. So, if you're a Marvel fan or just looking for some lighthearted fun, give this game a spin. Your inner child (and your outer adult) will thank you.

That's all for now, folks! Hippo Penny out - see you next time in the world of gaming!
